radiographic_examinations.findings: Focal narrowing of a short segment of the distal thoracic esophagus; delayed passage of contrast material; intraesophageal reflux observed proximal to the narrowing; normal position of the duodenojejunal junction; poststenotic dilatation and subtle vertical striations consistent with gastric folds in a sliding hiatal hernia.
A stenosis was encountered 18 cm from the incisors; mucosa was normal in this area; stricture measured approximately 1 cm in length with normal appearance of distal esophagus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Mild improvement in stricture observed after dilation; however, no complete dilatation was achieved.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: upper gastrointestinal imaging with contrast enhancement
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Not applicable as this was a postoperative follow-up.
